greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter (for counting primes of form 4k+1, 4k+2 and 4k+3): a(n) = 4*A032742(n) + (A020639(n) mod 4), a(1) = 1.
comment: For all i, j: a(i) = a(j) => A079635(i) = A079635(j). This follows because A079635(n) can be computed by recursively invoking a(n), without needing any other information.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: With[{k = 4}, Table[Function[{p, d}, k d + Mod[p, k] - k Boole[n == 1]] @@ {#, n/#} &@ FactorInteger[n][[1, 1]], {n, 91}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 12 2017 *)
program: def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else 4*divisors(n)[-2] + (min(primefactors(n))%4) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 12 2017
xref: Cf. A001511, A007814, A065339, A079635, A083025 (some of the matched sequences).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 11 2017
